p: There have been reports of high prevalence of blood-borne infections in the FSU region. Within FSU countries, Russia has the highest rate of HCV genotype 1b (50%), followed by HCV 3a (45%) [ 13]. These two HCV genotypes also appear to be predominant in other FSU countries; Uzbekistan (1b, 64.2%; 3a, 25%), Azerbaijan (1b, 71.1%; 3a, 17%), Tajikistan (1b, 84.6%; 3a, 7.6%), Lithuania (1b, 54.3%; 3a, 23.9%), Estonia (1b, 71%; 3a, 24%), and Georgia (1b, 62%; 3a, 27%) [ 14â€“ 19].
